quote_first: “So, it was routinely tracked every fifty minutes. The last reported sighting was at
quote_last: Central Menaya time. It was still coming sunward and nearly at the point of closest approach to Farholme - estimated to be at one hundred thousand kilometers out - but was still behaving itself."
quote_raw: “So, it was routinely tracked every fifty minutes. The last reported sighting was at 4:20 p.m. Central Menaya time. It was still coming sunward and nearly at the point of closest approach to Farholme - estimated to be at one hundred thousand kilometers out - but was still behaving itself."
title: The Shadow and Night
author: Chris Walley

quote_raw: 4.20 p.m. Watch television or a video
title: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time
author: Mark Haddon

quote_first: Hence it happened that he shouted out the hour, which was
quote_last: , in his big voice through the growing twilight; and somehow the loudness of it made it seem like the proclamation of something tremendous.
quote_raw: Hence it happened that he shouted out the hour, which was twenty past four, in his big voice through the growing twilight; and somehow the loudness of it made it seem like the proclamation of something tremendous.
title: The Oracle of the Dog
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote_last: - or, to put it another, blunter way, an hour and twenty minutes past what seemed to be all reasonable hope - the unmarried bride, her head down, a parent stationed on either side of her, was helped out of the building.
quote_raw: At twenty minutes past four - or, to put it another, blunter way, an hour and twenty minutes past what seemed to be all reasonable hope - the unmarried bride, her head down, a parent stationed on either side of her, was helped out of the building.
title: Raise High the Roof Beam, Carpenters
author: J.D. Salinger
